<a id="GPUParticlesCollisionSphere3D"></a>

# GPUParticlesCollisionSphere3D

**Inherits:** [GPUParticlesCollision3D](GPUParticlesCollision3D.md) **\<** [VisualInstance3D](VisualInstance3D.md) **\<** [Node3D](Node3D.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A sphere-shaped 3D particle collision shape affecting [GPUParticles3D](GPUParticles3D.md) nodes.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A sphere-shaped 3D particle collision shape affecting [GPUParticles3D](GPUParticles3D.md) nodes.

Particle collision shapes work in real-time and can be moved, rotated and scaled during gameplay. Unlike attractors, non-uniform scaling of collision shapes is *not* supported.

\ **Note:** [ParticleProcessMaterial.collision_mode](ParticleProcessMaterial.md#ParticleProcessMaterial_property_collision_mode) must be [ParticleProcessMaterial.COLLISION_RIGID](ParticleProcessMaterial.md#ParticleProcessMaterial_constant_COLLISION_RIGID) or [ParticleProcessMaterial.COLLISION_HIDE_ON_CONTACT](ParticleProcessMaterial.md#ParticleProcessMaterial_constant_COLLISION_HIDE_ON_CONTACT) on the [GPUParticles3D](GPUParticles3D.md)'s process material for collision to work.

\ **Note:** Particle collision only affects [GPUParticles3D](GPUParticles3D.md), not [CPUParticles3D](CPUParticles3D.md).
